description._content: Image digitised from the book 'Early Australian Architecture' by Frank Walker, 1942. "The Blue Mountain Inn was erected in the early thirties and in its time has enjoyed the distinction of entertaining governors, judges, merchants, and even the humble, and in those days, fairly plentiful, bushranger...the unpretentious little building has long since been demolished. Built of brick, with the original shingles concealed by the modern iron roofing, the shape of its doors and windows soon marks it, to the observant eye, as a building of the past." - Frank Walker This image is part of a collection entitled ‘Touring the Past - Tourism and History in Australia', which is available to view on the Royal Australian Historical Society's Historypin Channel. Access the collection at the following link: www.historypin.com/channels/view/id/48441/#|collections/v... Please feel free to comment on this or any of the other images in the collection. If you have more accurate information regarding the location and/or date of the image, we would love to hear from you!
